preclusion: LSM2251 Ecology and Environment and LSM4262 Tropical Conservation Biology
description: An introduction to the principles of conservation ecology, including population, community, ecosystem-level, and genetic approaches. Students will learn the theoretical underpinnings of ecology and studies of small populations, as they pertain to conservation biology. Students will address classic case studies in the discipline as well as explore relevant examples from Singapore and around Southeast Asia. An emphasis of the module is conservation in an increasingly urban world.
title: Conservation Ecology
prerequisite: YCC2137 Scientific Inquiry 2 or with the permission of the instructor.
